content:
I just came across this scanning #drupal7 tweets: https://twitter.com/Agileana/status/1278158665443430406

For those who don’t aren’t looking forward to leaving #drupal7 https://www.agileana.com/blog/what-if-you-dont-want-to-leave-drupal-7/ #drupal8 #backdropcms #drupal9 #wordpressvip

- Agileana (@Agileana)
BTW, it's almost a month old.
@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) it's already added in https://backdropcms.org/news/mentions
I was just made aware of this: https://www.jeffgeerling.com/comment/11729#comment-11729
The comment specifically, or the article in general?

On a side note, I kicked off a small project on BackdropCMS the other day. I was joyously surprised. It felt like being at home again.

Awww :heart:
At the end of the comment.

That article looks new: https://drudesk.com/blog/upgrade-from-drupal7-to-drupal9-alternatives

Your website upgrade from Drupal 7 to Drupal 9: a look at alternatives
Some business owners are reluctant to upgrade from Drupal 7 to Drupal 9, so what could be the alternatives for them? Let’s list them in this post.

However, you shouldn’t choose the Backdrop alternative if you plan to go to Drupal 9 some time in the future. There will be no upgrade path to do this.

...I don't like how these things are phrased (basically the fact that they will eventually be re-hashed and re-used in other articles)

...we should make an effort to change that to something like:

Same as with Drupal 7, a Backdrop site will require a migration process to move to D8 or D9
...something along those lines anyway (my brain isn't working at the moment)

klonos said:

However, you shouldn’t choose the Backdrop alternative if you plan to go to Drupal 9 some time in the future. There will be no upgrade path to do this.

...I don't like how these things are phrased (basically the fact that they will eventually be re-hashed and re-used in other articles)

Don't forget they're a Drupal shop marketing for business - they have a stake in discouraging migration to Backdrop. Would be nice if we could change that, but ...
True :disappointed:
I don't know about that, the article says they will help with anything.
Whatever you choose, the Drudesk website maintenance and support service is here. Drupal website upgrades, CMS changes, and long-term support are our daily routine
Well, I wrote up a comment, but now I'm not sure if I should post it...
did it anyway :)
Your comment looks good to me.

Well, I wrote up a comment, but now I'm not sure if I should post it...

Nice response.
Good comment IMO @jenlampton :-)
